semantic_identifier: 84: feat: Debounce Sales Accelerator uplifts by requiring multi-signal evidence before boosting issue priority

sections.text:
## Description

This PR adds evidence-based gating to Sales_Accelerator opportunity linkage so a single, one-off deal ask can’t materially increase an issue/theme priority score.

Implementation details:
- Introduces an "uplift eligibility" check in the priority scoring pipeline that evaluates sales-driven signals before applying the sales uplift.
- Requires a minimum evidence threshold to apply uplift:
  - >= 2 distinct linked opportunities (deduped by opportunity_id/account_id), OR
  - 1 linked opportunity + >= 1 corroborating support conversation (per issue/theme) within the configured lookback window.
- If the threshold is not met, the sales uplift component is suppressed (treated as 0 / ignored) while the rest of the scoring inputs remain unchanged.
- Persists suppression metadata on the issue/theme object for auditability:
  - salesUpliftStatus: APPLIED | SUPPRESSED
  - salesUpliftSuppressionReason: e.g., INSUFFICIENT_OPPORTUNITY_COUNT | MISSING_CORROBORATION
  - salesUpliftEvidenceSummary: counts of distinct opportunities / support conversations used for the decision
  - salesUpliftEvaluatedAt timestamp
- Updates the UI to surface when an uplift was suppressed (and why) alongside the sales/opportunity section so prioritization remains defensible.
- Adds tests covering: single-opportunity suppression, multi-opportunity acceptance, opportunity+support acceptance, dedupe behavior, and stable scoring across re-evaluations.

User impact:
- Issues/themes will no longer jump in priority from a single linked deal ask; sales uplift will only apply once sufficient evidence is present, and the UI will indicate when/why uplift was suppressed.

## How Has This Been Tested?
